genresAdvancedInfo.name: japanese buddhist chant
genresAdvancedInfo.description: Japanese Buddhist chant is a traditional form of vocal music that has been practiced in Japan for centuries. It involves chanting sacred texts and prayers in a meditative and contemplative manner. The chants are usually accompanied by the sounds of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shakuhachi, koto, and taiko drums. The music is deeply spiritual and is often used in religious ceremonies and rituals.
